monuments.name: Taj Mahal
monuments.description: The Taj Mahal, an ivory-white marble mausoleum, was built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his beloved wife, Mumtaz Mahal. It is a UNESCO World Heritage site and one of the Seven Wonders of the World.

monuments.name: Qutub Minar
monuments.description: Qutub Minar is a 73-meter tall tapering tower of victory, built in 1193 by Qutb-ud-din Aibak. It is a UNESCO World Heritage site and one of the tallest brick minarets in the world.

monuments.name: Gateway of India
monuments.description: The Gateway of India is an iconic arch monument built in the early 20th century in Mumbai. It was erected to commemorate the landing of King George V and Queen Mary in India in 1911.

monuments.name: Red Fort
monuments.description: The Red Fort is a historic fortification in the heart of Delhi, built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in 1648. It served as the main residence of the Mughal emperors and is now a UNESCO World Heritage site.

monuments.name: Hampi
monuments.description: Hampi is an ancient village known for its ruins of the medieval Vijayanagara Empire. It is a UNESCO World Heritage site, housing temples, palaces, and sculptures.
